title.narrative: Security Support to UN and Implementing Partners Operating in South Sudan

description.narrative:
The significant increase in demand for humanitarian agencies to access areas affected by humanitarian crisis and spreading conflict has led to an increased need to conduct ad-hoc security risk assessments (SRAs) to support access negotiations and take advantage of windows of opportunity to deliver critical humanitarian assistance. The project will create a humanitarian security team supervised by the Deputy CSA (Operations) that services the prioritized needs outlined in the humanitarian strategic response plan - with a focus on security risk assessments (SRAs), briefings and advisories. Additional funding is requested for flight hours for a dedicated security aircraft to permit DSS the flexible deployment of security personnel to conduct SRAs, and to provide rapid security support and response, including complementing UNHAS capacity for staff relocations and medical evacuations.
The joint UNDP/UNDSS and WFP/UNHAS proposal (14-RR-UDP-001 / 14-RR-WFP-002) aims to provide dedicated security support for humanitarian operations in South Sudan from January to June 2014. UNDSS will deploy two field security coordination officers and hire one national database operator and administrative assistant to bolster DSS services in South Sudan. WFP will contract and operate a plane dedicated to DSS security and risk assessment missions. DSS expects to carry out 120 missions (requiring 540 flight hours) over the six-month implementation period.
